text.title: Pubmed Literature interactions of p70-S6K1
text.more:
Co-ocurrence network of S6K1 interactions from Pubmed Literature. Network analysis was against search results of pubmed (covering 2008 to 2013) using synonyms and aliases for key regulatory kinase, S6K1, gleaned from related Pubmed abstracts.
Navigating the map:
The map’s default view is set to display all the interactors and categories at once. You can select the individual categories you’re interested in and more carefully analyze the links existing between them and the interactors. Understanding the map: As shown in the map’s navigation bar, a node’s color indicates the category it belongs to, and a node’s size indicates its hub degree (overall number of outbound links). That is, the more links a node sends to other interactors shown on the map, the bigger it appears on the map. The network was constructed in Gephi using a Force Atlas layout as most node relationships centered on mTOR and Akt. Under other layouts, most placements clustered too tightly to the center and didn't give much separation.
 The displayed space is not based on the cardinal system (North, East, South, West), which means that the choice of a relative left-right or top-down position is purely arbitrary.
 Navigate inside the interactors map and analyze in detail the relations between interactors.
text.intro: Co-ocurrence network of S6K1 interactions from Pubmed Literature (2008 to 2013)
